content.headline: Who's on your college application team?

options.option: Family, friends, school-based counselor, private tutor
options.response: Trust me, I'm MORE than covered by my high-powered college support team.

options.option: Just family, friends and school-based counselor
options.response: My college application team is my family, friends and school-based counselor.
People close to me are providing support — but I'm not getting much from my school.
I've got a few folks I can count on as we figure out this college stuff together.

options.option: Nobody — I'm on my own buddy!
options.response: I'm my own dream team! (At least that's what I tell myself ... but it'd be nice to have more support.)

content.headline: How academically hard-core do you want to be?

options.response: I want a school with hard-core academic rigor where I'll be surrounded by people to laugh and cry with through our loooong nights of cramming.
I want a medium academically-challenging school — somewhere between constant all-nighters and rolling out of bed for a lecture at noon.
I want a chill academic environment with plenty of nights to binge-watch shows (and other amusements).

content.headline: How big (or small) do you want your school to be?

options.response: I prefer a tiny school that feels like one big family.
I prefer a small school where I'll see lots of familiar faces.
I prefer a medium-sized school, so I'm not running into awkward Tinder dates on my way to class.
I prefer a big school, where I don't have to see the same faces outside of class more than once in 13 business days.

content.headline: What will make college financially feasible for you?

options.response: You won't find me graduating with a ton of debt. Low-cost schools only, please!

options.option: Strong need-based aid offerings (grants, loans, on-campus jobs)
options.response: I'm ready to hustle! I get that college is expensive and want schools that offer lots of aid options.
I'm pretty sure I won't qualify for need-based aid but will definitely throw my hat into the ring for those merit-based options.

content.headline: Where do you want your school to be?

options.response: I'm a city person. I only want schools where a coffee shop is steps away at all times.
Suburbs are under-rated. That's where I want to be.
I need room to breathe when I'm stressed out. Take me to the countryside.
Seeking campuses where I can pop out for a beach day whenever school gets rough.
I'm someone who hikes my way through stress — access to high altitude clears the mind (or mine at least).

options.option: Someplace where it's sunny and warm most days
options.response: I'm not trying to trudge through snow banks just to get to class. Temps under 60 give me the chills.
